option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/nicks/IdeaProjects/MonopolyGame":"{\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script that configures a Kotlin-based project. It sets up the necessary dependencies and plugins for the project, including Kotlin, Ktor (a web framework), Kotlinx Serialization, and Kotlinx Coroutines. The project is set up as a desktop application with the main class being `MainKt`. The file does not contain any explicit class or function definitions, but rather sets up the project configuration for the build process.\",\"/src/main/kotlin/Main.kt\":\"This file is a Kotlin Compose Desktop application that implements a Monopoly game. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`Player`: A data class representing a player in the Monopoly game, with properties for name, position, balance, and owned properties.\\n\\n`Property`: A data class representing a property in the Monopoly game, with properties for name, cost, rent, and owner.\\n\\n`Card`: A data class representing a Monopoly card, with properties for description and an effect function.\\n\\n`MonopolyGameUI`: A Composable function that creates the user interface for the Monopoly game, including the game board, player information, and a button to roll the dice.\\n\\n`Board`: A Composable function that renders the game board, with each property represented as a rectangle on the canvas.\\n\\n`createBoard`: A function that creates a list of `Property` objects representing the properties on the Monopoly board.\\n\\n`startServer`: A function that starts a Ktor server to handle WebSocket communication between the client and server.\\n\\n`main`: The entry point of the application, which sets up the initial players, starts the server, and launches the Compose Desktop application.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script that sets up the project configuration for a Monopoly game. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the project name and enables the Foojay Resolver Convention plugin, which is used to manage the Java toolchain used for the project.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Applies the \\\"org.gradle.toolchains.foojay-resolver-convention\\\" plugin with version \\\"0.8.0\\\". This plugin is used to manage the Java toolchain used for the project.\\n2. Sets the root project name to \\\"MonopolyGame\\\".\"}"}
